subject: RE: [junit] How to run selected Testcases which satisfy a condition in one go
msgSnippet: You might want to take a look at TestNG which allows among many other features tagging test cases and then running those by groups. www.testng.org
messageBody:
You might want to take a look at TestNG which allows among many other
features "tagging" test cases and then running those by groups.



www.testng.org <http://www.testng.org/>



Andreas





________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Ejaz Nasser
Sent: Monday, July 03, 2006 9:28 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] How to run selected Testcases which satisfy a condition
in one go



Is it possible to run some test case of testclasss in one go? For
example,
say I have10 testcases in MyTest.java class. I want to run say 4 of them
which contains the keyword say "File" in one go. I know by selecting the
4
of them would work, but it is pain and laborus work.
Thanks
